entries.title: Who Loves You More Than Your Mother
entries.method: 1. Pre-heat the oven to 200C/3C/gas 5. Place the carrot, leek and tofu in a large bowl. Add the stock and mix well. 2. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. 3. Place the mixture in a large bowl and cover with a lid. 4. Place the lid on the oven and cook for 40 minutes. 5. Serve with a slaw of your choice

entries.title: Why Your Boss Hates You
entries.method: 1. Pre-heat the oven to 200C/3C/gas 5. Add the pasata, green pepper and mushrooms to the base. Place the lid on the oven and cook for 30 minutes. 5. Serve with a slaw of your choice

entries.title: How to Alienate Your Friends
entries.method: Combine all ingredients in a conversation. Stir vigorously until everyone is uncomfortable. Let it simmer in awkward silence for 10-15 minutes. Garnish with a non-apology and serve immediately. Best enjoyed alone.

entries.title: Where to Hide from Your Responsibilities
entries.method: 1. Construct a fort with the blanket. 2. Infuse the snacks with denial. 3. Turn on the TV and marinate your brain for at least 5 hours, or until responsibilities have seemingly vanished. 4. Do not leave the fort for any reason. If found, pretend to be a lump of laundry.

entries.title: What to Do With Your Last Ounce of Patience
entries.method: Carefully measure out the deep breath and hold for 5 seconds. Slowly combine with the stunned silence. Whisk in the forced smile until your cheeks hurt. Gently fold in the non-committal response. Walk away before it curdles.

entries.title: How to Win an Argument on the Internet
entries.method: Present your conviction as undisputed fact. When challenged, liberally sprinkle in misinterpreted statistics. If opponent persists, add a dash of ad hominem. Season generously with CAPS LOCK. Block the other user and declare victory. Never check for replies.
entries.cookingTime: 15 minutes of your life you'll never get back

entries.title: Why You Bought That Hobby Stuff and Never Used It
entries.method: Combine fleeting inspiration with unrealistic expectations in a large bowl. Let the mixture sit in a prominent place in your home for 3-6 months. As aspirational guilt forms, occasionally glance at the half-watched tutorial. Store indefinitely in a closet.

entries.title: A Delicious Meal for One on a Friday Night
ingredients: Whatever is left in the fridge
entries.method: Combine all edible ingredients in a single bowl. Cover liberally with shredded cheese. Microwave until the cheese is melted and the resignation has set in. Serve in front of the TV. Pairs well with scrolling through photos of your friends who are out having fun.

entries.title: How to Look Busy in an Open-Plan Office
entries.method: Apply the furrowed brow and stare intently at a spreadsheet. For added effect, switch between spreadsheets every 5 minutes. Put on headphones to create an unapproachable aura. Emit a weary sigh every half hour to signify a heavy workload. Serves one career.

entries.title: The Art of the Graceful Irish Exit
ingredients: A sudden, feigned interest in the nearest exit
The social awareness of a ninja
A pre-written 'Sorry I missed you!' text
entries.method: Identify your escape route early. Mingle your way towards the exit, using the full drink as a prop. When you sense a lull in conversation, make a clean break. Do not make eye contact. Do not say goodbye. Deploy the pre-written text 30 minutes later. Best served without a trace.

entries.title: How to Respond to 'We Should Hang Out Sometime'
entries.method: Combine enthusiastic agreement with intentional vagueness ('Yes, totally! Things are so crazy right now though!'). Allow the lack of follow-through to dissolve any actual obligation. The mutual understanding will develop on its own. Let it rest for 3-5 months before repeating the recipe.

entries.title: When You Realize You're the Oldest Person at the Party
ingredients: A sudden urge to discuss mortgage rates
entries.method: Allow the crushing clarity to wash over you. Attempt to blend in by using slang incorrectly. When the urge to discuss mortgages becomes overwhelming, suppress it with a sip of whatever the kids are drinking. Let the aching back guide you to the nearest chair, or preferably, home to your bed.

entries.title: How to Survive a Family Gathering
ingredients: A handful of neutral conversation topics
Strategic placement near the snack table
entries.method: Upon arrival, immediately secure a position near the snacks; this provides a convenient excuse to disengage from conversation. Deploy neutral topics like the weather. When asked about your life, deliver the vague, rehearsed update. When your social battery hits 10%, execute the exit strategy without hesitation.

entries.title: The Perfect Snack for Your Existential Crisis
ingredients: A profound sense of cosmic indifference
entries.method: Place the block of cheese on a plate. You do not need to slice it. Consume crackers and cheese while staring into the void. Ponder the fleeting nature of existence. Continue until either the cheese is gone or the indifference subsides. It is usually the cheese.
